title: What is Clickjacking (UI Redressing)?
content: Explain how clickjacking works and why it's dangerous.
sampleAnswers: Clickjacking tricks users into clicking invisible or disguised elements, causing unintended actions like approving transactions, changing settings, or enabling permissions.

title: How can you prevent Clickjacking attacks?

options.text: Use X-Frame-Options header to deny framing
Use Content Security Policy frame-ancestors directive
Ensure HTTPS is used
Use JavaScript frame-busting techniques

explanation: X-Frame-Options, CSP frame-ancestors, and frame-busting scripts protect against clickjacking. HTTPS alone does not prevent it.

title: What is a Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) attack?
content: Explain how MITM attacks can compromise web applications.
sampleAnswers: MITM occurs when an attacker intercepts communication between a user and a server, allowing them to read, modify, or inject malicious data without either party knowing.

title: How can HTTPS prevent MITM attacks?

options.text: Encrypts data in transit
Authenticates the server using certificates
Prevents phishing attacks
Prevents unauthorized data tampering

explanation: HTTPS encrypts traffic and verifies server identity, reducing MITM risks. It does not automatically prevent phishing.

title: What are common signs that a website might be vulnerable to XSS?

options.text: User input is reflected without sanitization
Using dangerouslySetInnerHTML without sanitation
Input validation for forms
Content loaded dynamically from unknown sources

explanation: Reflected input, unsanitized HTML rendering, and dynamic content from untrusted sources are common XSS vulnerabilities.

title: Why should frontend developers care about security headers?
content: Explain their role and importance in web security.
sampleAnswers: Security headers like CSP, X-Frame-Options, and Strict-Transport-Security help protect against XSS, clickjacking, and MITM attacks by instructing the browser on safe behavior.

title: What is the purpose of the HttpOnly cookie attribute?

options.text: Prevents JavaScript from accessing the cookie
Encrypts cookie contents
Prevents cookies from being sent over HTTP
Automatically rotates session cookies

explanation: HttpOnly restricts access to cookies from JavaScript, reducing XSS risks.

title: What is the main danger of storing JWT tokens in localStorage?
sampleAnswers: JWT tokens in localStorage are accessible via JavaScript, making them vulnerable to XSS attacks. If stolen, attackers can impersonate users.

title: How can Reactâ€™s default escaping help prevent XSS?

options.text: Automatically escapes data in JSX expressions
Prevents execution of scripts in user content
Replaces the need for server-side validation
Removes all HTML from user input

explanation: React escapes data in JSX, preventing scripts from executing. However, server-side validation is still required.

title: What is the role of TLS/SSL certificates in web security?
content: Explain how TLS/SSL certificates protect users and applications.
sampleAnswers: TLS/SSL certificates encrypt traffic between the browser and server, ensuring data confidentiality, integrity, and authentication, which prevents eavesdropping and MITM attacks.
